title: PCT 08: Sweet-Grass as a young man
author: Coming-Day

sentences.original: kîtahtawê mîkiwâhpihk ohci sipwêhtêw, kêkâ-mitâtaht êh-ihtasicik ê-sipwêhtêcik, ê-mostohtêcik, êh-nitonawâcik iyâhciyiniwah.
sentences.text: kîtahtawê mîkiwâhpihk ohci sipwêhtêw kêkâ-mitâtaht ê-ihtasicik ê-sipwêhtêcik ê-mostohtêcik ê-nitonawâcik ayahciyiniwa
sentences.english: At one time he set out from his lodge; nine men were in the party; they went on foot, looking for Blackfoot.

sentences.original: kîtahtawê niyânanwâw êh-tipiskâyik, niyânanwâw ê-kîh-nipâcik, mostoswah wâpamêwak.
sentences.text: kîtahtawê niyânanwâw ê-tipiskâyik niyânanwâw ê-kî-nipâcik mostoswa wâpamêwak
sentences.english: When five nights had passed and five times they had slept on the way, they saw some buffalos.
One man went out to shoot them.

sentences.original: êh-nipahât pêyak, kahkiyaw êkotah itohtêwak êh-wiyanihâcik, ê-wîh-mîcisocik.
sentences.text: ê-nipahât pêyak kahkiyaw êkota itohtêwak ê-wiyanihâcik ê-wî-mîcisocik
sentences.english: When he had killed one, all went there to skin it and cut it up, and to eat.

sentences.original: êkwah ê-kîsi-mîcisocik, omaskisiniwâwah êh-kaskikwâtahkik, êh-mîsahahkik ê-pîkopayiyikih, êyakô wîhkasko-kisêyin pasikôw, ê-sipwêhtêt êh-pêyakot.
sentences.text: êkwa ê-kîsi-mîcisocik omaskisiniwâwa ê-kaskikwâtahkik ê-mîsahahkik ê-pîkopayiyiki êwako wîhkasko-kisêyin pasikôw ê-sipwêhtêt ê-pêyakot
sentences.english: When they had eaten and were sewing moccasins or mending such as were torn, Sweet-Grass arose and went off alone.

sentences.original: êwakôw ayênâniwosâp êh-tahtopiponwêt awa kâ-sipwêhtêt, ê-wîh-kakwê-wâpamât iyâhciyiniwah.
sentences.text: êwako ayinânêwosâp ê-tahtopiponwêt awa kâ-sipwêhtêt ê-wî-kakwê-wâpamât ayahciyiniwa
sentences.english: Eighteen years old was he when he then set out to see Blackfoot.
Meanwhile the others stayed where they were.

sentences.original: êh-asawâpit êh-wîh-kakwê-wâpahtahk kêkway, êh-ispatinâyik êkot êh-pa-pimisihk, kisiwâk ôtah osêhcâyiw;
sentences.text: ê-asawâpit ê-wî-kakwê-wâpahtahk kêkway ê-ispatinâyik êkota ê-pa-pimisihk kisiwâk ôta osêhcâyiw
sentences.english: When he looked out to see what there was to be seen, as he lay there on a rise of the land, close by the land was hilly;
he could not see anything.
After a while he heard something come thudding.

sentences.original: kîtahtawê wâpamêw êh-pê-sâkêwêpayiyit mostoswah mihcêt, kâ-wâpamât ayâhciyiniwah mihcêt êh-pê-nawaswâtâyit ôhi mostoswah, êh-wîh-nipahâyit.
sentences.text: kîtahtawê wâpamêw ê-pê-sâkêwêpayiyit mostoswa mihcêt kâ-wâpamât ayahciyiniwa mihcêt ê-pê-nawaswâtâyit ôhi mostoswa ê-wî-nipahâyit
sentences.english: Then he saw a great herd of buffalos come forth and saw a large band of Blackfoot coming in pursuit of the buffalo, to kill them.
He could not flee, for if they saw him, they would kill him.
He hid there in a small clump of trees;

sentences.original: êkotah pimisin, acosisah êh-tahkonahk; nama kêkway pâskisikan.
sentences.text: êkota pimisin acosisa ê-tahkonahk nama kêkway pâskisikan
sentences.english: there he lay, holding his arrows; he had no gun.

sentences.original: itah kâ-pimisihk, kisiwâk otah pimipayiyiwah mostoswah.
sentences.text: ita kâ-pimisihk kisiwâk ôta pimipayiyiwa mostoswa
sentences.english: Close by the place where he lay came the buffalos.

sentences.original: itê kâ-pêy-ohtohtêyit, êkotêh misiwê nipahêyiwah mostoswah.
sentences.text: itê kâ-pê-ohtohtêyit êkotê misiwê nipahêyiwa mostoswa
sentences.english: Everywhere in yon direction whence they had come, the others had killed buffalos.

sentences.original: êkwah êh-itâpit, misiwêw wâpamêw itêh kâ-kîh-itohtêyit.
sentences.text: êkwa ê-itâpit misiwê wâpamêw itê kâ-kî-itohtêyit
sentences.english: And when he looked this way, he saw them all going on.

sentences.original: kîtahtawê êh-pimisihk, nâway êh-pêy-ihtâyit ôw îyâhciyiniwah, iskwêwah êh-wîcêwâyit, owîkimâkaniyiwah,
sentences.text: kîtahtawê ê-pimisihk nâway ê-pê-ihtâyit awa ayahciyiniwa iskwêwa ê-wîcêwâyit owîkimâkaniyiwa
sentences.english: At last, as he lay there, behind the rest came a  Blackfoot with a woman, his wife;
the man carried a gun;
these came to where he was.
The woman saw him.

sentences.original: wîhtamawêw owîkimâkanah awah iskwêw, ôh êh-pimisiniyit nêhiyawah.
sentences.text: wîhtamawêw owîkimâkana awa iskwêw ôhi ê-pimisiniyit nêhiyawa
sentences.english: She told her husband that a Cree lay there.
[no translation]

sentences.original: êkwah awa nêhiyaw kâ-pimisihk acosis ômah otinam, ôh iyâhciyiniwah êh-pimwât; nipahêw.
sentences.text: êkwa awa nêhiyaw kâ-pimisihk acosis ôma otinam ôhi ayahciyiniwa ê-pimwât nipahêw
sentences.english: Then the Cree who lay there took an arrow like this and shot the Blackfoot, killing him.
The woman ran away.

sentences.original: âsa mîn êwakoni ôh îskwêwah pimwêw; mîn êwakonih nipahêw.
sentences.text: âsay mîna êwakoni ôhi iskwêwa pimwêw mîna êwakoni nipahêw
sentences.english: Then he shot the woman; her too he killed.
So then he got up;

sentences.original: ôhi nâpêwah kâh-nipahât pâskisikan otinam; otêmiyiwah nîso otinêw;
sentences.text: ôhi nâpêwa kâ-nipahât pâskisikan otinam otêmiyiwa nîso otinêw
sentences.english: he took the gun from the man he had slain, and his two horses;
he mounted.

sentences.original: êkw ôw iyâhciyiniwa mihcêt itê kâ-nipahâyit mostoswah, êkotêh itohtêw, êh-têhtapit.
sentences.text: êkwa awa ayahciyiniwa mihcêt itê kâ-nipahâyit mostoswa êkotê itohtêw ê-têhtapit
sentences.english: Where those Blackfoot had killed many buffalos, thither he went, now on horseback.

sentences.original: âta wiya wî-maskamêw; namôya wîh-kitâpamêw, êh-kostahk ta-nisitawêyimikot êh-nêhiyawit.
sentences.text: âta wiya wî-maskamêw namôya wî-kitâpamêw ê-kostahk ta-nisitawêyimikot ê-nêhiyâwit
sentences.english: He wanted to rob them, but he did not want to look upon them, fearing they would know him for a Cree.
At last he passed them; he passed a great many people.

sentences.original: namôya kiskêyihtam kwayask êh-itohtêt pêyak ôhi iyâhciyiniwah êh-wiyanihâyit mostoswah.
sentences.text: namôya kiskêyihtam kwayask ê-itohtêt pêyak ôhi ayahciyiniwa ê-wiyanihâyit mostoswa
sentences.english: He had unwittingly  gone straight to one of the places where the Blackfoot were preparing buffalo.
Beyond retreat he had gone there.

sentences.original: êkosi tânisi kî-tôtamân ? itêyihtam, ê-kostât êwakonih.
sentences.english: “What can I do?” he thought, fearing them.

sentences.original: apisîs ohpimêh pimohtêw, êh-têhtapit, pêyak ê-sakâpêkinât misatimwah, ayâhcînawah otêmiyiwah êh-maskamât êyakonih kâ-nipahât.
sentences.text: apisîs ohpimê pimohtêw ê-têhtapit pêyak ê-sakâpêkinât misatimwa ayahciyiniwa otêmiyiwa ê-maskamât êwakoni kâ-nipahât
sentences.english: He rode a bit to one side, leading by the bridle the other one of the horses he had taken from the Blackfoot he had slain.

sentences.original: êkw ôhih kâ-kâh-kitâpamikot nisitawêyimik êh-nêhiyawit, êh-otinâyit otêmiyiwah;
sentences.text: êkwa ôhi kâ-kâh-kitâpamikot nisitawêyimik ê-nêhiyâwit ê-otinâyit otêmiyiwa
sentences.english: Then when one of the others looked at him, he knew he was a Cree and that he had taken some of their horses;
white horses they had;
and so he fled.
Then the other mounted.
When the Blackfoot mounted, he whooped;
his companions looked.
In this way those Blackfoot started off in a crowd.
And so the Cree fled.

sentences.original: êkwah awa kâ-nisitawêyimât nêhiyawah nawaswâtêw ôhi nêhiyawah, ê-wîh-kakwê-nipahât.
sentences.text: êkwa awa kâ-nisitawêyimât nêhiyawa nawaswâtêw ôhi nêhiyawa ê-wî-kakwê-nipahât
sentences.english: The one who had recognized him as a Cree pursued him to kill him.

sentences.original: êkwah awa nêhiyaw êh-âpasâpamât, mahti kisiwâk kit-âyât.
sentences.english: When the Cree looked back at his pursuer, “I shall let him get near.”

sentences.original: ôhi kâ-na-nawaswâtikot kisiwâk ayâyiwa, kisiwâk êh-askôkot.
sentences.text: ôhi kâ-na-nawaswâtikot kisiwâk ayâyiwa kisiwâk ê-askôkot
sentences.english: Closer and closer behind him came he who was pursuing.
A long way had the other come;

sentences.original: wayonipitêw ôhi kâ-têhtapit ê-môskîstawât ôhi wâhyaw kâ-pê-nakasiwêyit.
sentences.text: wâyonipitêw ôhi kâ-têhtapit ê-môskîstawât ôhi wâhyaw kâ-pê-nakasiwêyit
sentences.english: he turned back the horse and attacked the man who had come outdistancing his companions.
The other saw him near and shot at him.
He missed him and fled.
Then he shot at the other; he knocked him from his horse, killing him.
This one's  horse also he took.
Then he fled.

sentences.original: kâ-mihcêticik aniki ayâhciyiniwak êh-otihtâcik ôhi kâ-nipahimiht, êkotah poyowak.
sentences.text: kâ-mihcêticik aniki ayahciyiniwak ê-otihtâcik ôhi kâ-nipahimiht êkota poyowak
sentences.english: All the other Blackfoot, when they reached the one who was slain, stopped there.
He was already too far away in his flight

sentences.original: êkwah owîcêwâkanah aspin kâ-kîh-nakatât itah kâ-kîh-mîcisocik, êwakonik wiyah êh-pêhtahkik êh-mâh-matwêwêyik, kîh-tapasîwak, ê-mosci-pimipahtâcik, maskôc nipahâw, êh-itêyihtahkik ,- ôhih kâ-kîh-ntawi-ây-asawâpiyit.
sentences.text: êkwa owîcêwâkana aspin kâ-kî-nakatât ita kâ-kî-mîcisocik êwakonik wiya ê-pêhtahkik ê-mâh-matwêwêyik kî-tapasîwak ê-mosci-pimipahtâcik ê-itêyihtahkik ôhi kâ-kî-nitawi-ay-asawâpiyit
sentences.english: Then his companions whom he had left there where they had eaten, when they heard the shots, fled running on foot, thinking, “Perhaps the others have killed him,” - the one who had gone to reconnoitre.

sentences.original: êwakw âwah kâ-kîh-ntaw-asawâpit, êwakô nîso nipahêw ayâhcînawah;
sentences.text: êwako awa kâ-kî-nitawi-asawâpit êwako nîso nipahêw ayahciyiniwa
sentences.english: But he who had gone to reconnoitre had killed two Blackfoot;
he had taken three horses from them and one gun;
he had killed one woman.
That Cree found his comrades.

sentences.original: êkwah âcimôw oma k-êsi-wâpahtahk, k-ês-ôtinât ôhi misatimwah.
sentences.text: êkwa âcimôw ôma ka-isi-wâpahtahk kâ-isi-otinât ôhi misatimwa
sentences.english: Then he told of what he had experienced and of how he had taken those horses.
They stayed there where he found his comrades.

sentences.original: êkwah êh-tipiskâyik, êkotah ohci kâwih sipwêhtêwak, êh-itohtêcik ôh iyâhciyiniwah itah êh-wîkiyit, êkwah êh-kimotamawâcik otêmiyiwah.
sentences.text: êkwa ê-tipiskâyik êkota ohci kâwi sipwêhtêwak ê-itohtêcik ôhi ayahciyiniwa ita ê-wîkiyit êkwa ê-kimotamawâcik otêmiyiwa
sentences.english: When night came, they set out again, going to where those Blackfoot dwelt, and stole their horses from them.
Then they fled.

sentences.original: kîwêwak; êkwah piyis êkos îsi takosinwak wîkiwâhk.
sentences.text: kîwêwak êkwa piyis êkosi isi takosinwak wîkiwâhk
sentences.english: They returned home, and so at last reached their camp.
The one who did thus, was Sweet-Grass.
That is the story.
